class_notes:
FR 488 W : Surréalismes 
C. Nouvet / T Th 2:30-3:45pm
Content:  In the wake of World War I, the avant-garde movement known as "surrealism" proposed not just a new aesthetic, but a new way of life devoted to the exploration of another kind of reality, the psychic reality that psychoanalysis had discovered. This exploration, as we shall see,  was undertaken in multiples genres (painting, photography, photomontages, literature, movies) and through collaborative projects.  As they proposed new ways of looking at reality which influenced later artists, the surrealist also looked backwards.  They identified their precursors, visionary writers  (Apollinaire, Rimbaud and Nerval) and painters (Bosch) that inspired them and that we will also study. 
 
TEXTS may include: 
Eluard:Capitale de la douleur [selections] 
Breton: Nadja 
Manifestes du surréalisme 
Valentine Penrose: Dons des Féminines  [selections] 
Ernst: La femme 100 têtes 
Dali: La vie secrète de Salvador Dali 
Eluard et Ray: Les mains libres 
Nerval: Aurélia 
Apollinaire:     Alcools             [selections] 
Rimbaud: Illuminations [selections]
course_description: Courses will include the study of a variety of subjects in French and/or francophone literature and culture. May be repeated for credit.
prerequisites: FREN 310, FREN 314 and two 300 level FREN courses, or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
